dataset.title: Inorganic nutrient dynamics in the lower Indian Bend Wash watershed: period 2002-2003

creator.organizationName: Global Institute of Sustainability, Arizona State University

abstract.para: This survey set was designed to evaluate the degree to which the various stream and lake segments in the lower portion of Indian Bend Wash acted as sources or sinks for dissolved inorganic nutrients ( SRP, NO3, and NH4 .

Complete surveys of the study reach were conducted on 23 dates in 2002 and 19 dates in 2003. Surveys were approximately monthly during winter and more frequent during summer, with survey frequency increasing directly after floods. In addition to complete surveys, a subset of points was also sampled during 6 flood events. Sample locations included inlets and outlets of all lakes between the outlet of L-1 and the outlet of L-8, plus additional inlet and outlet sites for other hydrologic inputs and off-channel components of the system.

listitem.para: While CAP LTER will make every effort possible to control and document the quality of the data it publishes, the data are made available "as is".
CAP LTER cannot assume responsibility for damages resulting from mis-use or mis-interpretation of datasets or from errors or omissions that may exist in the data.
It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists that has resulted in data used in subsequent research.
CAP LTER expects that any use of data from this server will be accompanied with the appropriate citations and acknowledgments.

CAP LTER encourages users to contact the original investigator responsible for the data that they are accessing. Where appropriate, researchers whose projects are integrally dependent on CAP LTER data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original investigators.
CAP LTER requests that users submit to the Global Institute of Sustainability, ASU, one copy of any publication resulting from the use of data obtained from this site.
CAP LTER requests that users not redistribute data obtained from this site. However, links or references to this site may be freely posted.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Phoenix metropolitan area and surrounding desert, Arizona, USA

section.para: This survey set was designed to evaluate the degree to which the various stream and lake segments in the lower portion of Indian Bend Wash (Fig 3.1) acted as sources or sinks for dissolved inorganic nutrients (SRP, NO3, and NH4).
Conduct surveys monthly during winter and more frequent during summer, with survey frequency increasing directly after floods
Conduct sampling with two teams of people moving upstream.
Dissolved oxygen and temperature will be measured in the field using either a YSI 85 or YSI 95.
Measure Height of the flow by using the bridge (if avalible). Measure to the top of the water and subtracting the known height of the bridge from the measured height.
Estimate the flow through the pipe as the difference between the average discharge through the entire study reach and the discharge out of lake H.
Record all measurements on spreadsheet and process samples in the lab.

attribute.attributeDefinition: whether the sample was taken in the morning or afternoon
Discharge in m3min-1 as estimated from direct measures of either discharge or stage height.

textDomain.definition: Note the discharge through the reach was assumed tobe constant except where flows were split (around Lakes H orG) or where additions were made (Well). Finally, dischargeout of Lake A could not be estimated.
